UK Citizens in Argentina: Complete Immigration Guide

Post-Brexit, more Britons are exploring Argentina for its affordability, lifestyle, and adventure opportunities. The digital nomad visa provides an excellent pathway for UK remote workers, while historical Anglo-Argentine connections create familiar touchpoints.

Visa Options

Tourist Entry

No visa required

UK citizens enter visa-free with valid passport

Duration: 90 days (extendable to 180)

Digital Nomad Visa

Recommended

Ideal for UK remote workers post-Brexit

Income requirement: Â£2,000-2,500/month equivalent

Work Visa

Sponsorship Required

Work visa requires local sponsorship or company formation

Required Documents

Passport Validity

6 months recommended

Criminal Record Check

Required (with apostille)

ACRO police certificate with apostille required for residency

Birth Certificate

Required (with apostille)

Additional Documents

  • â€¢ For digital nomad: proof of remote employment
  • â€¢ For work visa: employment contract or business plan
  • â€¢ Proof of means of support
  • â€¢ Health insurance (recommended)

Path to Residency

Easiest Route

Digital Nomad Visa

Timeline

Digital nomad: 30-45 days. Work visa: 60-90 days. Citizenship in 2 years.

Steps:

  1. 1Enter Argentina on 90-day tourist visa
  2. 2Decide on pathway: digital nomad, work visa, or investment
  3. 3Gather documents (ACRO certificate takes 2-3 weeks)
  4. 4Apply for chosen visa type
  5. 5Receive precaria (allows work/stay during processing)
  6. 6Pick up visa/residency card
  7. 7Apply for citizenship after 2 years

Tips:

  • â€¢The digital nomad visa is excellent for UK remote workers
  • â€¢Bring USD cash for blue rate exchanges
  • â€¢Get your ACRO certificate before traveling (apostille required)
  • â€¢British culture has left marks on Argentina - you'll find familiar elements
  • â€¢The Anglo-Argentine community has deep historical roots
  • â€¢Tea culture ( tÃ© ) and afternoon snacks (merienda) will feel familiar
  • â€¢Polo and rugby have strong British influence in Argentina
  • â€¢Consider the Falklands history - be sensitive in conversations

Frequently Asked Questions

Do UK citizens need a visa for Argentina?

No visa required for 90 days entry. Post-Brexit, the digital nomad visa is excellent for UK remote workers wanting to stay longer.

How's the cost of living compared to the UK?

Significantly lower. With the blue dollar rate, costs can be 60-70% less than London and 50% less than other UK cities. A Â£2,000-2,500 monthly income provides a comfortable lifestyle.

Can I work remotely for my UK company?

Yes! The digital nomad visa is specifically designed for this. You can work remotely for UK companies while legally residing in Argentina.

Is there British influence in Argentina?

Yes, significant. British immigrants built Argentina's railways, introduced football, polo, and tea culture. You'll find historic Anglo-Argentine clubs and communities.

What about the Falklands issue?

The Falklands/Malvinas remains a sensitive topic. Most Argentines distinguish between British people and British government policy. Be respectful if the topic arises.

Practical Information

Currency Exchange

GBP can be exchanged in BA, though USD often preferred for better rates. Wise, Western Union popular for transfers.

Banking

Open accounts with residency. Many Britons use UK cards initially, then open Argentine accounts after establishing residency.

Tax Treaty

âœ“ Yes - UK-Argentina have tax agreements. UK citizens may need to file UK taxes depending on residency status. Consult accountant.

Dual Citizenship

âœ“ Allowed
